snippet: Prospects for a long-term strategic partnership between the longtime allies appeared to be dimming, despite an American offer to transfer detention centers to the Afghans in six months.
abstract: Prospects for a long-term American strategic partnership with Afghanistan appears to be dimming, despite American offer to transfer detention centers to Afghans in six months; burning of Korans by American soldiers appears to have hardened the differences between the longtime, if wary, allies.

byline.contributor: Matthew Rosenberg contributed reporting from Washington.

lead_paragraph: Prospects for a long-term strategic partnership between the longtime allies appeared to be dimming, despite an American offer to transfer detention centers to the Afghans in six months.

headline.seo: U.S. Leeway on Detainees Fails to Mend Afghan Talks
headline.main: U.S.-Afghanistan Talks Falter Despite Leeway on Detention Facilities
headline.print_headline: U.S.-Afghanistan Talks Falter Despite Leeway on Detention Facilities

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject
